lead_paragraph: Islamist militants claimed responsibility for the latest of several fatal attacks in Bangladesh, but officials said was too early to settle on a motive.

byline.contributor: Julfikar Ali Manik reported from Dhaka, and Geeta Anand from Mumbai, India.
byline.original: By JULFIKAR ALI MANIK and GEETA ANAND

headline.print_headline: ISIS Claims Latest Killing in Bangladesh
headline.main: ISIS Says It Killed Bangladesh Tailor Once Jailed for Blasphemy

snippet: Islamist militants claimed responsibility for the latest of several fatal attacks in Bangladesh, but officials said was too early to settle on a motive.
abstract: Islamic State militants claim responsibility for killing Nikhil Chandra Joarder, Hindu tailor previously jailed over claims he made negative comment about Prophet Muhammad; violent attack occurred near his shop in Tangail district in central Bangladesh; is latest in string of similar killings to sweep nation.

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
